screensframework

Class LoginController

  • java.lang.Object
    • screensframework.LoginController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable, ControlledScreen

    public class LoginController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable, ControlledScreen
    FXML Controller class for the Login page. Allows a user to enter their login details, determines whether or not they exist in the database and then sends them the correct way based on their type (Customer or Employee).

      • login

        private void login(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Checks user's login details against the database. If the user is of type "Customer", creates a new Customer object and initialises it with the database data. If the user is of type "Employee", creates a new Employee object and initialises it. The user is then sent to the correct follow-on screen depending on their permission level. Triggered by clicking Login.
        Parameters:
        event - the User clicks the "Login" button
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the database file cannot be found.

      • goToStaffHomePage

        private void goToStaffHomePage(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        Sends the user to the staff home page.
        Parameters:
        event - user requests to go to the Staff home page

      • buttonPressed

        public void buttonPressed(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent ke)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Checks user's login details against the database. If the user is of type "Customer", creates a new Customer object and initialises it with the database data. If the user is of type "Employee", creates a new Employee object and initialises it. The user is then sent to the correct follow-on screen depending on their permission level. Triggered by pressing Enter.
        Parameters:
        ke - any time a key is pressed. Specifically listens for the "Enter" key.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the database file could not be found.

      • goToRegistrationPage

        private void goToRegistrationPage(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        Sends the User to the registration page.
        Parameters:
        event - the User clicks the "Register" button.
